data.title: Best authentic Italian pizza I've ever had in the U.S.
data.text: I use to live in Fullerton and went back to visit some of my friends. While there I drove around my old Cal State Fullerton stopping grounds and my friends recommended Fuoco Pizzeria for dinner. I have to say it is the best pizza I've ever had in the U.S. I have been to Italy a few times and the best pizza, of course, was in Naples. This pizza tasted exactly the same as if I were back in Naples. I ordered the margherita pizza. Loved seeing them make it and baking it in the firewood ovens. The crust was super thin, the cheese was so good and not too heavy and the tomato sauce was delicious. I went with my husband and two daughters and it was so good that we each finished a whole pizza by ourselves and even shared an incredible Nutella pizza for dessert. I highly recommend it. Not only was the food good but the staff was very friendly. I will be dreaming of coming back very soon. Keep doing what your doing! Delicious!!

data.title: Also Try the Panini
data.text: This is a great place for pizza!  Not your typical run-of-the-mill pizza.  No.  This is an artisanal type of pizza, as it is made in Naples, Italy.  A thin hand-tossed, wood oven-baked pizza that is out of this world.  It is meant to be eaten quickly.  Why?  Because the moisture of the sauce, cheese and toppings make the thin-crusted pie soggy after a while.  Don't take long to eat it.  Another thing I can recommend is the panini--excellent choice--served with a generous green salad.  I have only been there for lunch, at which time there is no waiting.  In the evening, I do not know nor can I guarantee that you won't be waiting.

data.title: Excellent food and outstanding service
data.text: This has been our fifth visit at Fuoco and we usually leave completely satisfied and look forward to coming here again. Last night we enjoyed the house salad, special Black Truffle Pizza (divine), a Mushroom Pizza (great) and topped it off with their Nutella Pizza and Nutella misu - everything is consistently excellent and they have a wonderful team to serve customers with a fantastic attitude. I would give this place six stars and highly recommend it.

data.title: Killer crust and tasty toppings
data.text: The incredibly hot oven does something to the pizza that can't be done in the "chain" pizzerias.  The dining area is spacious, service staff is friendly and efficient, and plenty of  beverages to choose from.  It is a little annoying with all the TV's however.  Parking can be problematic, so you may have to walk a distance but it is worth the effort.  We are repeat customers and always recommend to friends.

data.title: THE BEST PIZZA I HAVE EVER HAD!
data.text: My family and I stopped by Fuoco Pizzeria after reading hundreds of positive Yelp reviews while drooling over the pictures! We were in NEED of delicious pizza after spending a few months in Naples, Italy. We were blown away by all of the delicious pizza and the to-die-for Nutellamisu! I loved the charm the restaurant had and how the owners came over to us and asked us how our meal was. I'm all about good customer service and they totally nailed it with their level of excellence. We stayed for a few hours and topped of our meal with their imported Italian wine, beer and I had to have their famous Gelato! My family and I will be back again and I can't tell you how amazing our dining experience was. Thank you to the entire Fuoco team, my family and I felt like we were back in Italy :)

data.title: You will love this pizza!
data.text: I recently went to Naples Italy, and had an excellent Pizza...... What first came to mind was "this is just like Fuoco!" Now when I miss that beautiful town, I will go to Fuoco and relive my Italian adventure. Fuoco is the only place I have been that makes pizza this authentically! Enjoy!

data.title: Just like Naples
data.text: I keep coming back to this great restaurant. Great food, Great Service. Don't forget about the mini size pizzas...Smaller than the big brother but more affordable. Enjoy

data.title: Yummilicious Pizza
data.text: It was exactly what I expected delicious, filling pizza. Courteous, efficient and friendly staff. Very welcoming and helpful as soon as you walk in.

data.title: Delcious pizza and food
data.text:
Friendly and attentive staff. Food was hot, fresh and delicious! 
We will go back soon. 
We have both gluten free and vegetarian diets in our family and the menu easily accommodated us!

data.title: Deliziosa
data.text: I never had a pie that was great since I've moved to OC (16 years). My physical therapist sent me to this restaurant. The name gave it away, and my husband loved Naples' food the best, so we were off. Oh my, the pizza was delish. I had the Margherita, and my husband had the sausage. The salad and dessert were great--ambiance too. Okay, I fibbed. Mario Batali, in NB, has good pie, but this is just right (much less $ also, if you're watching your budget. Mario's place is called Pizzeria Mozza). Buon appetito...

data.title: Real Italian Pizza!
data.text: I've heard so much about this place and had to try it for myself.    It is ever better than I expected.  The pizza is like no other pizza I have ever had.  Fresh cooked Italian Pizza baked in a brick oven.  Everything is homemade, even the cheese, imported from Italy.   The service is excellent, very nice but casual atmosphere.  Great place to have a date night.  I love Wednesday Night is half price wine night.  I don't want to ever eat regular pizza from chain restaurant again.  Try it, great location too.

data.title: Real Pizza
data.text: Great place to hang out, everyone is always happy to greet you and the pizza? MAMMA MIA!! I order the Diavola and some san peregrino...always hits the spot.

data.title: Excellent food and service!
data.text: Fuoco has great thin crust pizza, excellent salads and sandwiches. Service is also excellent. It  is just a good fun place to eat!!

data.title: Un pezzo di Napoli in California
data.text: Great food, great people, great atmosphere. If you are looking for an authentic Italian experience you have to try Fuoco, Franco (the owner) will make you fell like home and serve great food.

data.title: the best pizza in the US
data.text: i am a italian national and have lived in this country for 38 years.  i will say, without hesitation, that fuoco makes the best pizza in the US, and even better than a number of pizzerie in italy.  i have watched this restaurant thrive over the years and i couldn't be happy for them.  the owners, franco and tullio, are wonderful hosts (despite the fact that they hate juventus).  always a pleasure to dine at fuoco.

data.title: Satisfying my Craving
data.text: My hubby and I have been here more than several times and I feel I need to add to the reviews again..... The pizza here is so authentic and delicious that we need our culinary "fix" about once a month. We regrettably have tried other wood fired pizza places...I won't bother naming but have ruled out any competition. If you want real Italian pizza then head on over and treat yourself. BRAVO FUOCO!

data.title: GREAT for families
data.text: We love going here for family night. two adults and 2 small boys under 2 and its never a problem finding a seat. The food is quick, the staff is easy and we can be as loud as we want and its normal. Lots of families go here for a quick dinner out. Great place for pizza and caprese!

data.title: Want to feel like you're in Italy? Then eat here.
data.text: Everything from the pizza crust to the cheese and meat plates to the Spumoni - All are a step above anything I've had in typical Italian restaurants in OC. I love eating here. Give me some red wine, pear and greens salad, fig pizza with Italian meats, spumoni with European style coffee - Fantastic!

data.title: Vera Pizza Napoletana
data.text: Went for dinner with my family and I'm a pizza lover of course who isn't so this was not like any pizza I,had ever seen before it was authentic Italian pizza my dad stayed in Italy for many years he said the atmosphere and food brought him back to Italy we loved it!  Fuoco we will be back

data.title: Fuoco =Fire  The pizza oven is awesome, made in Italy.
data.text:
The wood burning pizza oven, is just like in Naples, the home of PIZZA.  This is the best pizza you can get this side of Naples.  We had a family reunion there and everyone was impressed.  The Caprese Salad is great.  The pizza's were thin and eaten with knives and fork.  Deserts were splendid.  The lemon ice cream with Limoncello, you don't find anywhere else! Delicious!
The Fuoco's
